title: RL31654
content: The Endangered Species Act (ESA) provides legal protection to identified species and their habitats, administered by the Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS) and the National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS). Species can be listed as "endangered" or "threatened" based on extinction risk assessments, leading to legal tools for recovery and habitat protection. Prohibitions include unpermitted "take" of endangered species and actions that may jeopardize listed species' existence. The Endangered Species Act (ESA) prohibits unpermitted "take" of endangered species and requires agencies to ensure their actions do not harm listed species or critical habitat.
